thread.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be on Sky before any other TV or subscription service - Movies
thread.title_full: Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be on Sky before any other TV or subscription service - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Mayer Nissim
title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be on Sky before any other TV or subscription service - Movies
text: Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be on Sky before any other TV channel or subscription service.The broadcaster today (October 12) announced that it has signed a new multi-year movie and TV deal with Disney UK & Ireland. © Lucasfilm / Disney Everything we know about Star Wars: The Force Awakens, including trailers, cast, release date and spoilersPixar's Inside Out and The Good Dinosaur will also premiere on the channel in the first pay TV window around nine months after their cinema release.Managing director of content at Sky Gary Davey said: "This new agreement means our customers can continue to enjoy the biggest blockbusters like Star Wars: The Force Awakens and Inside Out before they are available on any other online subscription service." SVP and general manager of media distribution at Disney EMEA Mark Endemaño added: "Two years on from its launch, we are particularly proud of the shared success of Sky Movies Disney, and look forward to bringing more of our much-loved stories and characters to audiences in the UK & Ireland." function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID); modVP = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.VIDEO_PLAYER); modExp = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.EXPERIENCE); modCon = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.CONTENT); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.BEGIN, onVideoStart); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.STOP, onVideoStop); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.PROGRESS, onVideoProgress); } #_containermyExperience4177827935001 { height: 100%; } // InSkin integration parameters: InSkinParams['myInSkin14177827935001'] = { 'srv_SectionID': '', 'srv_SectionIDPlay': '123757', 'srv_Keywords': '', 'plr_ContentID': 'myExperience4177827935001', 'plr_ContentType': 'BRIGHTCOVE3', 'plr_ContentW': 558, 'plr_ContentH': 314, 'plr_NoSkinContentResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinContentW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinContentH': 348, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinH': 348, 'plr_ResizeOnHideSkin': true, 'plr_HideSkinOnExternalAd': 'all', 'plr_ShowSkinAfterExternalAd': true, 'cnt_SmartPlayer': true }; // create the InSkin object: var InSkinObject4177827935001 = new InSkin.Base('myInSkin14177827935001'); brightcove.createExperiences(); if (!navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i)) { InSkinObject4177827935001.init(); ai_type="video"; } 7 craziest rumours about Star Wars The Force Awakens: Is Darth Vader back from the dead?Sky viewers can watch the Sky Movies Disney channel and the most recent Disney, DisneyPixar, Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm movies in HD and, where available, in 3D.Disney Channel, Disney XD and Disney Junior will continue to be available in SD and HD for viewers subscribing to those channels.Sky promises to offer more Disney channels at no extra cost via its On Demand and Catch Up TV functions.Also covered in the new deal are ABC Studios TV shows including Scandal, Grey's Anatomy and Scrubs, available via Sky Box Sets and ABC Studios on demand.
